column30:
*Background*
Front-end work and accessibility testing effort for uploading and deleting avatar.

Figma: [https://www.figma.com/design/yyAxcNFkmELHbOy0QPKoou/Account-manager-in-SAP4me-Tickets?node-id=1479-14699&t=NTSp75Gtjr37fxEM-1] [https://www.figma.com/design/yyAxcNFkmELHbOy0QPKoou/Account-manager-in-SAP4me-Tickets?node-id=1232-16949&t=66AddmyqSZnY9xn7-1]
Implementation Technical Details > [https://wiki.one.int.sap/wiki/x/40sEQgE]

*Technical Details [Avatar Client API]:*
Profile team has implemented UID Avatar Upload, Delete and resizing > [https://profile.sap.com/. |https://profile.sap.com/] Here are some details on their implementation
 #  Overall avatar editing ui code is incorporated to the repository [https://github.tools.sap/sap-community/com.sap.profile.ui]
 # Precise location of the implementation is [https://github.tools.sap/sap-community/com.sap.profile.ui/tree/main/src/modules/profile/components/avatar-editor]
 # *react-easy-crop* [https://github.tools.sap/sap-community/com.sap.profile.ui/blob/main/package.json#L45]  [https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-easy-crop]  and  *react-dropzone* [https://github.tools.sap/sap-community/com.sap.profile.ui/blob/main/package.json#L44]. [https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-dropzone] are used + r{*}eact-image-file-resizer{*} [https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-image-file-resizer]
 # [AvatarEditor.tsx|https://github.tools.sap/sap-community/com.sap.profile.ui/blob/main/src/modules/profile/components/avatar-editor/AvatarEditor.tsx] is implemented by our team to assemble dialog from libs functionality.

*Acceptance Criteria*
A/C #1 - Avatar upload
GIVEN User uploads a image
WHEN Image format is jpeg. 
THEN avatar image is updated and success message is shown

A/C #2 - Avatar upload (validation)
GIVEN User uploads a image
WHEN Image format is not jpeg. 
THEN Show error message, avatar upload not successful image to the user
 
A/C #3 - Avatar delete
GIVEN User deletes avatar image
THEN Show message that avatar was successfully deleted

 

+*Technical:*+

*_Upload:_*

 
{code:java}
POST /v1/avatar?idsName={idsName}

Headers:
Authentication: Bearer {accessToken}
Content-Type: multipart/form-data

Body:
multipart/form-data -> file
key: avatar
value: {file.jpeg}
Content-Type: image/jpeg  {code}
 

_Note: Allow upload only jpeg files._

*_Delete_*
{code:java}
DELETE /v1/avatar?idsName={idsName}

Headers:
Authentication: Bearer {accessToken}
{code}
 

+*List of possible validation errors*+
{code:java}
MISSING_MULTIPART_DATA
TOO_MANY_FILES
IMAGE_NAME_MUST_BE_AVATAR
IMAGE_FORMAT_ONLY_JPEG
IMAGE_INVALID_DATA
MISSING_IDS_NAME
USER_IS_INACTIVE
INVALID_USER {code}
 

+*_Format of error messages:_*+
{code:java}
{
  "details": "MISSING_IDS_NAME",
  "traceId": "68ef62a078ee7381e0d5b52c9723c4fd"
} {code}

Focus on:
 * Code clean up
 * Better state management

Profile team has implemented feature to upload IDS Avatar Image. SAM backend should integrate with profile API to upload and delete avatar image, also SAM backend should expose endpoints secured by access_token to upload and delete avatar image. 

Avatar implementation is documented here > [https://wiki.one.int.sap/wiki/x/40sEQgE]
 * Url generation logic with salt is implemented as part of UIDX-6313, refactore the code so *avatar-owner i.e* the unique IDS image value generation is one place. 
 * Validate the file format is jpg. On error, return http status 400 (Bad request)

 * If the profile api is down. Return status 500, try again later. **

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*
A/C #1 - Avatar upload
GIVEN user uploads a  image
WHEN Image format is jpeg. 
THEN call profile endpoint to save the image. Return http status 200 & image url you receive from profile api. 

 

A/C #2 - Avatar upload
GIVEN user uploads a image
WHEN Image format is not jpeg. 
THEN  Return http status 400, with appropriate error status. 

 

A/C #3 - Avatar delete
GIVEN user deletes image
THEN call profile endpoint to delete the image. Return http status 204. 

 

A/C #4 - Avatar api is down
GIVEN user upload or delete image
WHEN profile api is down. 
THEN return 500. 

Note: not possible to simulate for testing we are not owners of avatar api.

 

A/C #5 - Avatar api returns error
GIVEN user upload or delete image
WHEN profile api return error
THEN forward response to user

 

A/C #6 - Avatar api returns error
GIVEN user upload image with size bigger than 5 MB
THEN returns error HTTP 413

 

+*List of possible validation errors*+
{code:java}
MISSING_MULTIPART_DATA
TOO_MANY_FILES
IMAGE_NAME_MUST_BE_AVATAR
IMAGE_FORMAT_ONLY_JPEG
IMAGE_INVALID_DATA
MISSING_IDS_NAME
USER_IS_INACTIVE
INVALID_USER {code}
+*_Format of error messages:_*+
{code:java}
{
  "details": "MISSING_IDS_NAME",
  "traceId": "68ef62a078ee7381e0d5b52c9723c4fd"
} {code}
 

For testing needed to be used QA env as Profile API does not have dev env.

+*echnical:*+

*_Upload:_*

 
{code:java}
POST /v1/avatar?idsName={idsName}

Headers:
Authentication: Bearer {accessToken}
Content-Type: multipart/form-data

Body:
multipart/form-data -> file
key: avatar
value: {file.jpeg}
Content-Type: image/jpeg  {code}
 

_Note: Allow upload only jpeg files._

*_Delete_*
{code:java}
DELETE /v1/avatar?idsName={idsName}

Headers:
Authentication: Bearer {accessToken}{code}

06 Oct 2025 09:28;C5380841;Does it make sense for us to verify aspect ration of image?
We could allow to sent such images and leave Avatar service decide which aspect ratio is ok.

Note documentation of avatar does not place a restriction for ration. It is just mentioned that service will scale it to 1:1 ration.

[https://wiki.one.int.sap/wiki/display/ONEPROFILE/Avatar+API] 

!image-2025-10-06-11-28-42-144.png|width=522,height=311!

 

[~I753307] , [~C5403847] ?;;;
column349: 06 Oct 2025 09:33;C5403847;[~C5380841] we can leave out the verification if avatar service does not have any restrictions and will automatically scale it to 1:1 ratio;;;

[https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-dropzone] are used + r{*}eact-image-file-resizer{*} [https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-image-file-resizer]

20 Oct 2025 06:54;C5385621;There are two different behaviors found during testing, and they will be addressed within the scope of https://jira.tools.sap/browse/UIDX-6317

Responsive Dimensions:
985 x 1072 (Identity table and account details displayed):
When selecting any linked identity from the table, the avatar image displays the same image for every linked identity.
 
980 x 804 (Only identity table displayed):
When selecting any linked identity in the table and opening the account details:
The avatar image in account details is displayed correctly for identities that have an avatar image.
When switching to another identity without an avatar, the account details display the default avatar (no avatar).;;;

column30:
*As a* SAM user, *I want to have* separate avatars for different IDS identities *so that I* can manage better my linked accounts and switch easily between accounts

 

*Background*

To reflect what identity is currently authenticated we show the assigned avatar picture in the masthead. Post UID removal as IDP, user will need to be able to assign avatars on different IDS identity linked to UID. This story is about introducing such ability in SAM. 

Note the existing UID Avatar is not affected, it's still fetched from the profile.sap.com and the related APIs - see [wiki|https://wiki.one.int.sap/wiki/display/ONEPROFILE/Avatar+API]

*Technical Details*
 * This story is about preparing the FE & UX part required for UIDX-4705

 

*Note -* we aim to replicate the functional behaviour that is present on profile.sap.com, please check out how it works there currently

 

*Acceptance Criteria*
 * IDS account avatars can be hidden via feature toggle 
 * -Upon selecting an identity in the Identity table, user can view the existing avatar in the details section on the right-
 ** -If no avatar has been uploaded for that identity, user see default picture. Note: profile service provides picture in all cases even default one.-
 * Upon clicking Edit Avatar icon, users can browse for new avatar picture and then upload it
 ** Supported file formats - JPG , (?) PNG
 ** File max size limitation
 * Delete option is supported
 * Option to resize and crop the picture on screen is supported (see profile.sap.com)
 * Show success message or error upon new avatar upload

 

*Additional Info*

link to Figma: [https://www.figma.com/design/yyAxcNFkmELHbOy0QPKoou/Account-manager-in-SAP4me-Tickets?node-id=1232-16949&t=3nIvmut0rJ5mc2wl-0] 

 

Profile Github repo - [https://github.wdf.sap.corp/sap-community/com.sap.profile.ui/tree/main]

 

See files:
 * /com.sap.profile.ui-main/src/modules/profile/components/hero-unit/HeroUnit.tsx
 * /com.sap.profile.ui-main/src/modules/profile/components/avatar-editor/AvatarEditor.tsx

 

Link to Profile - [https://profile.sap.com/]

column30:
*Background*

When you try to update the UID avatar image in SAM, you get redirected to profile.sap.com.  As part of UIDX-6315, now IDS image can be uploaded from SAM. We want to extend this functionality to UID. 

Unify approach between IDS and UID for read, write (add it).

*Technical Details*
 * Unlike for IDS, there is no UID Salt value for uid. So you generate the hash, just using uid. 
 * UID avatar upload url /api/v1/avatars

*Acceptance Criteria:*

A/C #1 - UID avatar can be updated in SAM
GIVEN user is interested to update UID avatar image
WHEN an attempt to do so in SAM is made
THEN avatar can be updated directly, without redirect

column1: [FE] SAM | UID avatar - link to Profile app
column30:
*As a* SAM user, *I want to have* a link to Profile app to *so that I* can easily change my UID avatar

 

*Background*

 

*Technical Details*
 * Pattern for generating the link to Profile app that directly opens the modal (Edit Profile Picture screen). 

Link for direct edit:
{code:java}
https://profile.sap.com/?edit_avatar=true{code}

*Acceptance Criteria*
 * A new edit option is available for UID avatar
 * Clicking the option opens profile.sam.com in different tab with the _Edit Profile Picture_ modal opened

*Additional Info*

[Figma|https://www.figma.com/design/yyAxcNFkmELHbOy0QPKoou/Account-manager-in-SAP4me-Tickets?node-id=1232-16949&t=3nIvmut0rJ5mc2wl-0]

Profile env
 * [https://profile-qa.sap.com/]
 * [https://profile.sap.com/] 

Since there are only 2 env it should be verified on the QA env only.

On the DEV env can be checked only that there was used valid link to based on requirement.

column1: [BE] IDS Account Avatar | Write endpoint for avatars
column30:
*Background*

To reflect what identity is currently authenticated we show the assigned avatar picture in the masthead. Post UID removal as IDP, user will need to be able to assign avatars on different IDS identity linked to UID. So we will introduce such ability in SAM. Note the existing UID Avatar is not affected, it's still fetched from the profile.sap.com and the related APIs - see [wiki|https://wiki.one.int.sap/wiki/display/ONEPROFILE/Avatar+API]

This task is about creating new write endpoints that will allow users to upload such avatar in SAM

*Technical Details*
 * New endpoint to upload avatar in storage (Azure or DB) 
 ** Max size - introduce configurable limit
 ** File format - JPG and (?) PNG 
 ** Expected check aspect ratio is 1:1 (how do we validate that on the BE (?))
 ** Resize (pixels) - possible via configuration - we need some library to be able to resize (?)

 
 * Parameters
 ** TBC 

 

*Success Criteria*
 * Endpoint allows avatar upload 
 * Errors/Validations in place for file format, size, etc.
column348:

Are we expecting SPs, which does not use CTS to request the avatar rest API ?;;;
column349: 27 Feb 2025 10:19;C5392084;This story is about Write endpoints and avatar creation/upload will be done only in SAM. Regarding Read endpoints, yes, I would expect application that do not use CTS will want to display the avatar.;;;
column350: 25 Apr 2025 07:17;C5392084;Profile team will enhance their existing avatar solution to handle IDS account avatars. This story is redundant;;;

column30:
*Background*

To reflect what identity is currently authenticated we show the assigned avatar picture in the masthead. Post UID removal as IDP, user will need to be able to assign avatars on different IDS identity linked to UID. So we will introduce such ability in SAM. Note the existing UID Avatar is not affected, it's still fetched from the profile.sap.com and the related APIs - see [wiki|https://wiki.one.int.sap/wiki/display/ONEPROFILE/Avatar+API]

This task is about creating new read endpoints that will allow SAM, Account Switcher and other applications that want to make use of this functionality to display such avatar

*Technical Details*
 * Two new endpoints
 ** read avatar based on Custom algorithm or CTS scope (depending on agreed approach) - used by external Apps + Account Switcher
 ** read avatar based on IDS and verify that idsName belongs (linked under UID) to accessToken - used by SAM
 ** We need to have default avatar
 * Parameters
 ** TBC 

 

*Success Criteria*
 * Read endpoints return the correct result

column30:
*Background*

To reflect what identity is currently authenticated we show the assigned avatar picture in the masthead. Post UID removal as IDP, user will need to be able to assign avatars on different IDS identity linked to UID. This story is about introducing such ability in SAM. 

 

*Acceptance Criteria*
 * UID avatar - for now there will be no option to upload UID avatar in SAM but will provide an _Edit_ icon/button which will open [https://profile-qa.sap.com|https://profile-qa.sap.com/u/val_dinchev] in different tab. 
 * IDS account avatar
 ** Upon selecting an identity in the Identity table, user can view the existing avatar in the details section on the right
 *** If no avatar has been uploaded for that identity, user see default avatar 
 ** Upon clicking Edit Avatar icon, a popup/modal window opens where users can browse for new avatar picture (or drag and drop) and then upload it
 **  It's possible to delete an avatar from that window
 ** Show success message or error upon new avatar upload - "Your avatar has been updated. Please note that it may take up to 30 minutes before your avatar is updated on all SAP systems."
 ** Please check existing functionality on [https://profile-qa.sap.com|https://profile-qa.sap.com/u/val_dinchev]  Current understanding is that will re-use the existing backend from Profile application and we will only create a separate FE part on our side - but we should keep our UX as close as possible to theirs

column1: Account Manager | Avatar Picker For IDS User
column30:
*Brief Context*
To reflect what identity is currently authenticated we show the assigned avatar picture in the masthead. To be bae to do so we need a functionality in SAM to assign avatar photos to linked identities.

*Acceptance Criteria*
 - Provide possibility for all linked user to set an avatar picture. That picture will be used to show the current chosen account in the header area.
 -- Align with Community team if we can re-use the avatar picker they already created for UID users.

 *Additional Information*
 - Community avatar picker: Authenticate to community.sap.com. Click in the avatar in the upper right corner which open a pop-up. On that pop-up click 'My Account'. Now your profile opens where you can choose/change your avatar picture.
 - Contact person for account picker is Mirko Friedrich.
 - Same functionality as we use already for UID avatars. That functionality is now enhanced to support as well IDS accounts
 - Figma: [https://www.figma.com/design/yyAxcNFkmELHbOy0QPKoou/Account-manager-in-SAP4me-Tickets?node-id=1479-14699&t=NTSp75Gtjr37fxEM-1] [https://www.figma.com/design/yyAxcNFkmELHbOy0QPKoou/Account-manager-in-SAP4me-Tickets?node-id=1232-16949&t=66AddmyqSZnY9xn7-1]
 - Implementation Technical Details > https://wiki.one.int.sap/wiki/x/40sEQgE
